questionList.qu: Which vector represents the translation of a function in the form `y=a(b(x-c))+d`?
questionList.solution: C represents horizontal translation, and D represents vertical translation.

questionList.qu: Which vector represents the translation of the function `y=f(x+2)-3`?
questionList.solution: c is equal to -2, and d is equal to -3, therefore the vector (-2,-3) represents the translation.

questionList.qu: Which vector represents the translation of the function `y=f(x-4)-8`?
questionList.solution: c is equal to 4, and d is equal to -8, therefore the vector (4,-8) represents the translation.

questionList.qu: Which vector represents the translation of the function `y=f(x+3)+7`?
questionList.solution: c is equal to -3, and d is equal to 7, therefore the vector (-3,7) represents the translation.

questionList.qu: Which vector represents the translation of the function `y=f(x+3)+7`?
questionList.solution: c is equal to -3, and d is equal to 7, therefore the vector (-3,7) represents the translation.

questionList.qu: Which vector represents the translation of the function `y=f(x+3)+7`?
questionList.solution: c is equal to -3, and d is equal to 7, therefore the vector (-3,7) represents the translation.

questionList.qu: Which vector represents the translation of the function `y=2f(x+2)+4`?
questionList.solution: c is equal to -2, and d is equal to 4, therefore the vector (-2,4) represents the translation.

questionList.qu: Which vector represents the translation of the function `y=3f(x-3)+2`?
questionList.solution: c is equal to 3, and d is equal to 2, therefore the vector (3,2) represents the translation.

questionList.qu: Which vector represents the translation of the function `y=f(3(x+1))-3`?
questionList.solution: c is equal to -1, and d is equal to -3, therefore the vector (-1,-3) represents the translation.
